verses.verse: Moreover the LORD <WH3068> answered <WH6030> Job <WH347>, and said <WH559>,
Shall he that contendeth <WH7378> with the Almighty <WH7706> instruct <WH3250> him? he that reproveth <WH3198> God <WH433>, let him answer <WH6030> it.
¶ Then Job <WH347> answered <WH6030> the LORD <WH3068>, and said <WH559>,
Behold, I am vile <WH7043>; what shall I answer <WH7725> thee? I will lay <WH7760> mine hand <WH3027> upon <WH3926> my mouth <WH6310>.
Once <WH259> have I spoken <WH1696>; but I will not answer <WH6030>: yea, twice <WH8147>; but I will proceed no further <WH3254>.
¶ Then answered <WH6030> the LORD <WH3068> unto Job <WH347> out of the whirlwind <WH5591>, and said <WH559>,
Gird up <WH247> thy loins <WH2504> now like a man <WH1397>: I will demand <WH7592> of thee, and declare <WH3045> thou unto me.
Wilt thou also disannul <WH6565> my judgment <WH4941>? wilt thou condemn <WH7561> me, that thou mayest be righteous <WH6663>?
Hast thou an arm <WH2220> like God <WH410>? or canst thou thunder <WH7481> with a voice <WH6963> like him?
Deck <WH5710> thyself now with majesty <WH1347> and excellency <WH1363>; and array <WH3847> thyself with glory <WH1935> and beauty <WH1926>.
Cast abroad <WH6327> the rage <WH5678> of thy wrath <WH639>: and behold <WH7200> every one that is proud <WH1343>, and abase <WH8213> him.
Look <WH7200> on every one that is proud <WH1343>, and bring him low <WH3665>; and tread down <WH1915> the wicked <WH7563> in their place.
Hide <WH2934> them in the dust <WH6083> together <WH3162>; and bind <WH2280> their faces <WH6440> in secret <WH2934>.
Then will I also confess <WH3034> unto thee that thine own right hand <WH3225> can save <WH3467> thee.
¶ Behold now behemoth <WH930>, which I made <WH6213> with thee; he eateth <WH398> grass <WH2682> as an ox <WH1241>.
Lo now, his strength <WH3581> is in his loins <WH4975>, and his force <WH202> is in the navel <WH8306> of his belly <WH990>.
He moveth <WH2654> his tail <WH2180> like a cedar <WH730>: the sinews <WH1517> of his stones <WH6344> are wrapped together <WH8276>.
His bones <WH6106> are as strong <WH650> pieces of brass <WH5154>; his bones <WH1634> are like bars <WH4300> of iron <WH1270>.
He is the chief <WH7225> of the ways <WH1870> of God <WH410>: he that made <WH6213> him can make <WH5066> his sword <WH2719> to approach <WH5066> unto him.
Surely the mountains <WH2022> bring him forth <WH5375> food <WH944>, where all the beasts <WH2416> of the field <WH7704> play <WH7832>.
He lieth <WH7901> under the shady trees <WH6628>, in the covert <WH5643> of the reed <WH7070>, and fens <WH1207>.
The shady trees <WH6628> cover <WH5526> him with their shadow <WH6752>; the willows <WH6155> of the brook <WH5158> compass him about <WH5437>.
Behold, he drinketh up <WH6231> a river <WH5104>, and hasteth <WH2648> not: he trusteth <WH982> that he can draw up <WH1518> Jordan <WH3383> into his mouth <WH6310>.
He taketh <WH3947> it with his eyes <WH5869>: his nose <WH639> pierceth through <WH5344> snares <WH4170>.
